intro: Nototriche caesia, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it suitable for xeriscaping. The flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
